result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance Gene Meier

records.addlTxt: 2:30 PM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Lance Gene Meier in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelzin court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Max T. Lindsey appeared by video for Lance Gene Meier. DA Kelz states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. Contingent upon the defendant's plea to the sole charge in the complaint the state will move to Defer Entry of Judgement for 18 mo. and move to dismiss after the agreement has been fulfilled. Attorney Lindsey states there was a referral sent to the DA's office for additional charges. Court orders the Referral for obstruction filed in early march will not be charged. Attorney Lindsey agrees to the agreement and the terms. Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to the sole charge in the complaint. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders a deferred entry of judgement for a period of 18 months.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): S.M.T. unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office or with the Price County Sheriff's Office outside of normal business hours. 
 * No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:12 AM Attorney Max T. Lindsey appeared. Defendant does not appear however there is an authorization on record for the Attorney to act on his behalf. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Court orders the defendant come to the courthouse to sign his bond.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled for 04/14/2022 at 10:00 AM
Authorization for Attorney to Appear and Act
